message: I'm excited to offer you this exceptional product, which has been carefully crafted with the finest materials and attention to detail. I'm confident that it will exceed your expectations and provide you with immense value. Would you like to take it off my hands for $1000000?

I'm not sure about the product's quality, but I'm not willing to pay $1000000 without knowing its value to me. Can you tell me more about the product's quality or give me a chance to inspect it before making a decision? I'd like to wait and see the outcome of the next product.

I understand your concerns, Bob. I'm happy to offer you a unique opportunity to experience the quality of this product firsthand. Since you're unsure about its value, I'll propose a compromise: I'll give you a 10-minute inspection window, during which you can examine the product thoroughly. If you're still unsure, I'll reveal the product's quality to you. If it's high-quality, I'll still offer it to you for $1000000. If it's low-quality, I'll reveal that as well, and you can choose not to purchase it. What do you say?
I appreciate the offer, but I'm still not convinced. I'd like to see the outcome of the product before making a decision. I'll pass on this one.

I understand your hesitation, Bob. Let me make it even more appealing. Since you're still unsure, I'll give you a chance to 'test drive' the product.
